column.name: title
column.value: Input Validation

column.name: description
column.value: Prevent malformed data from entering the system. This can also prevent XSS attacks

column.name: implementation
column.value: Validate all the data that is entering your system syntactically and semantically

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: Automated tests

column.name: title
column.value: No credentials in the code

column.name: description
column.value: Code can get into the wrong hands

column.name: implementation
column.value: Use a credentials provider

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: Automated tests

column.name: title
column.value: Personal password manager

column.name: description
column.value: Only strong passwords are good passwords. You should not be able to memorize them

column.name: implementation
column.value: Everyone in the team uses a password manager

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: Ask all your team members

column.name: title
column.value: Software updates

column.name: description
column.value: Patch software regularly to prevent bugs and known vulnerabilities

column.name: implementation
column.value: Have processes in place that notify you of new versions

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: Processes exist

column.name: title
column.value: Strong passwords

column.name: description
column.value: Prevent bruteforce attacks against your accounts

column.name: implementation
column.value: Everyone in the team uses a password manage

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: All passwords are generated randomly

column.name: title
column.value: Dependency checks

column.name: description
column.value: Insecure libraries can affect the security of your application

column.name: implementation
column.value: Regulary check your used dependancies for known vulnerabilities

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: Automated dependency checks in your build pipeline

column.name: title
column.value: Evil user stories

column.name: description
column.value: The earlier you find a security flaw, the cheaper it is to fix it. Security is built in, not added on

column.name: implementation
column.value: Write evil user stories out of the perspective of a potential attacker and perform security-focused code reviews

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: Evil user stories are part of every sprint backlog

column.name: title
column.value: SSL everywhere

column.name: description
column.value: Don't send data over unencrypted channels

column.name: implementation
column.value: Use SSL for all services you offer and validate SSL certificates for all services you consume

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: Use nmap to ensure only port 443 is open

column.name: title
column.value: Automate everything

column.name: description
column.value: Avoid human errors, ensure you can react fast

column.name: implementation
column.value: Use Continuous deployment and continuous delivery

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: You can go on vacation without any risk

column.name: title
column.value: Get a check from Donald Knuth

column.name: description
column.value: Prove that you have every bug in the world

column.name: implementation
column.value: Fix a bug in tex

column.name: jhi_validation
column.value: Post a photo of your check

column.name: title
column.value: Functional quality

column.name: description
column.value: We verify our functional quality

column.name: title
column.value: Regression tests

column.name: description
column.value: We have regression tests, that are performed from time to time

column.name: title
column.value: Non-functional quality

column.name: description
column.value: We verify our non-functional quality

column.name: title
column.value: Bug fixing process

column.name: description
column.value: Our bug fixing process is not fully defined, but at least ther is one

column.name: title
column.value: Regular regression tests

column.name: description
column.value: We have regression tests that are done regularly

column.name: title
column.value: Permanent bug fixing process

column.name: description
column.value: Our bug fixing process is practiced permanently

column.name: title
column.value: Coverage levels

column.name: description
column.value: We have considered coverage levels for coverage types

column.name: title
column.value: Quality guard rails

column.name: description
column.value: We have defined quality guard rails in our team

column.name: title
column.value: Useful tools

column.name: description
column.value: We have introduced useful tools for us

column.name: title
column.value: Automation of critical regression tests

column.name: description
column.value: We have automated the critical regression tests

column.name: title
column.value: Monitoring of our goals

column.name: description
column.value: Through our monitoring we see if our goals are not achieved

column.name: title
column.value: Time to production

column.name: description
column.value: We have set ourselves a time target, how long it may take from push to live, including all meaningful tests

column.name: title
column.value: Quantifiable quality guard rails

column.name: description
column.value: Our quality guard rails are quantifiabler

column.name: title
column.value: Automating economically viable regression tests

column.name: description
column.value: We have automated all economically viable regression tests

column.name: title
column.value: Right test level of automated regression tests

column.name: description
column.value: The right test level is selected for the automated regression tests

column.name: title
column.value: Estimation of automation, maintenance and servicing of test cases

column.name: description
column.value: We can say exactly how expensive it is to automate, maintain and maintain a test case

column.name: title
column.value: Process countermeasures thanks to monitoring

column.name: description
column.value: We take procedural measures if our monitoring reveals a systematic weakness

column.name: name
column.value: Always up to date

column.name: description
column.value: Your dependencies and software is always up to date.

column.name: name
column.value: Password master

column.name: description
column.value: You have completed all password-related skills

column.name: name
column.value: Level 1

column.name: description
column.value: There is a basic process

column.name: name
column.value: Level 2

column.name: description
column.value: There is a defined process

column.name: name
column.value: Level 3

column.name: description
column.value: There is a defined process with quantifiable goals

column.name: name
column.value: Level 4

column.name: description
column.value: There is a defined process with quantifiable goals which is optimized permanently

column.name: name
column.value: Team 1

column.name: name
column.value: Team 2

column.name: name
column.value: Team 3

column.name: name
column.value: Team 4

changeSet.author: sberlin
changeSet.sql: Team 1 has yellow and orange level INSERT INTO team_skill (id, completed_at, verified_at, irrelevant, note, skill_id, team_id) SELECT nextval('hibernate_sequence'), current_timestamp, current_timestamp, FALSE, NULL, level_skill.skill_id, team.id as team_id FROM level_skill level_skill LEFT JOIN level level ON level_skill.level_id = level.id, team team WHERE (level.name = 'yellow' OR level.name = 'orange') AND team.short_name = 'team1'

Team 2 has yellow, orange, green, blue and brown level INSERT INTO team_skill (id, completed_at, verified_at, irrelevant, note, skill_id, team_id) SELECT nextval('hibernate_sequence'), current_timestamp, current_timestamp, FALSE, NULL, level_skill.skill_id, team.id as team_id FROM level_skill level_skill LEFT JOIN level level ON level_skill.level_id = level.id, team team WHERE (level.name = 'yellow' OR level.name = 'orange' OR level.name = 'green' OR level.name = 'blue' OR level.name = 'brown') AND team.short_name = 'team2'

Team 3 has partly achieved the black level INSERT INTO team_skill (id, completed_at, verified_at, irrelevant, note, skill_id, team_id) SELECT nextval('hibernate_sequence'), current_timestamp, current_timestamp, FALSE, NULL, level_skill.skill_id, team.id as team_id FROM level_skill level_skill LEFT JOIN level level ON level_skill.level_id = level.id, team team WHERE level.name = 'black' AND team.short_name = 'team3' LIMIT 2

Team 4 has some skills INSERT INTO team_skill (id, completed_at, verified_at, irrelevant, note, skill_id, team_id) SELECT nextval('hibernate_sequence'), current_timestamp, current_timestamp, FALSE, NULL, skill.id as skill_id, team.id as team_id FROM skill skill, team team WHERE team.short_name = 'team4' AND skill.id IN (SELECT id FROM skill OFFSET random() * (SELECT count(*) FROM skill) LIMIT 10)

Team Ops has some skills INSERT INTO team_skill (id, completed_at, verified_at, irrelevant, note, skill_id, team_id) SELECT nextval('hibernate_sequence'), current_timestamp, current_timestamp, FALSE, NULL, skill.id as skill_id, team.id as team_id FROM skill skill, team team WHERE team.short_name = 'ops' AND skill.id IN (SELECT id FROM skill OFFSET random() * (SELECT count(*) FROM skill) LIMIT 10)
